algorithm_technique: Check if the word is all uppercase, all lowercase, or if only the first letter is uppercase using built-in string methods.
problem_summary_simple: Check if a word's capitalization follows one of three rules: all caps, no caps, or only first letter capitalized.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize string methods like `isupper()`, `islower()`, and `istitle()` to efficiently validate the capitalization rules of the input word.
time_complexity: O(L) where L is the length of the word.
key_insights: Leveraging built-in string methods (`isupper`, `islower`, `istitle`) is the most concise and efficient approach.
The problem defines three specific valid capitalization patterns.
No complex data structures or algorithms are needed; direct string checks suffice.
